document.title: Roman Catholic Diocese of Joliet, Faith Formation Curriculum

jurisdiction.title: Roman Catholic Diocese of Joliet Illinois

02F1BA30ED3741239D589C616F9F6C6F.description:
Share their response to Scripture or Sunday readings as an
integral part of their lifelong faith formation.

0DA3A3F05EF64A9A81D27D013CFB235A.description: Attend Mass and discuss Sunday readings.

BEDC543AFE864573B1CA8AAABDFE4E7D.description: Read or tell Bible Stories together as a family.

554F732E9DCA41E18371D63A95D6D90E.description: Experience communal Scripture study and sharing as a basis for lifelong faith formation-Life Application

C805556AADAF41AE9F619B306EEFA576.description:
Share Scripture Stories as a group through drama, art,
music, technology, etc.

6554833EFE8E4B2289F1D85AF8FDE7F6.description: Identify and discuss Christian values in a Scripture Story.

8BC1F50C4B7E4A5CB59FBBB6910679C9.description: Discuss Scripture and apply it to their lives.

FE5B71025EC34C7FA3A2917ED93161CC.description:
Discuss the Sunday readings and when appropriate discuss
the Homily.

997FE9E39F8749D5AE7D0A838FFD3CBC.description: Experience communal Scripture study and sharing as a basis for lifelong faith formation-Skill

A8868C655873465E98C8AB03265E2532.description:
Know that Scripture can be used whenever we pray
together.

F0120B9E21574C2D9B8A9D600E3B0F98.description:
Know that the Homily is one way of sharing the meaning of
Scripture.

A4EB5B16B36F4BB5B49645561BAF5E7A.description:
Know that studying and sharing Scripture with others helps
us to learn how God is acting in our lives.

EBDC0F9A21BF40A3ACD4D268EA57E578.description: Experience communal Scripture study and sharing as a basis for lifelong faith formation-Knowledge

50E9C6E13FC04728BB06C2BDA6DE80A3.description: Recognize and engage in personal and communal Catholic forms of prayer, of Scripture study, and of other experiences that deepen one’s spiritual life.

CD3A35840765455D9E6B696BB78FDE08.description: Read the Bible and use it in prayer.

D7A600CBE57749B99FD2705027AD11B5.description: Understand how to read Scripture and to integrate Scripture into personal prayer-Life Application

FF471F1AECE446749061EDDBB528CB4B.description:
. Illustrate how Scripture is a part of personal prayer through
drama, art, music, technology, etc.

C1258C1D9A8640F1B332ED4191A2B20B.description: Locate passages in the Bible, i.e. chapter and verse.

F0594DFBB1F74BABA71B51D5B7EB2CA9.description:
Select a Scripture verse/story and discuss how it applies to
their lives and to world events.

420C82FD0AC04BAFA5BDC9D7F6CBAF7B.description:
Pray together using Scripture and/or readings from
Lectionary.

1223CF1BC1AC4DFA95CD3DF2B0A44771.description: Study Scripture and apply to their own experiences/lives.

EAE22CAEDC1746778C0A67EA8230F40E.description: Understand how to read Scripture and to integrate Scripture into personal prayer-Skill

B00B33238C7045FD9183D17E5F64D3C9.description:
Know Bible has two parts, The Old Testament (Jewish
Scripture) and The New Testament (Christian) and is a
library of different kinds of literature (history, poetry,
prophecy, etc).

0D9E4723EAA54B02B239994BBB833F44.description: Understand how those stories connect to their lives today.

4E5ED93E12674734A25D28AB7B065076.description:
Know that the prayers and stories of The Old Testament are
the stories that Jesus was taught and used.

7D8AB96399C642D8B4C8B64B685E46A9.description:
Know stories, parables and teachings of Jesus from the
Bible.

FD2C703C92134CF6AC4CEE806153F913.description: Know Scripture can be used in personal prayer.

E8CE4FB66B794C6FAAF918BB91530D88.description: Understand how to read Scripture and to integrate Scripture into personal prayer-Knowledge

43C2B0EEC31340E8B7B41A9B39350727.description: Recognize and engage in personal and communal Catholic forms of prayer, of scripture study, and of other experiences that deepen one’s spiritual life.

F16DCA20C9C44D1E8D4E524C80269010.description: Experience the importance of prayer and appreciate a variety of prayer types and traditions-Life Application

8C8A5093893B43FC854B669C451E17E0.description:
Illustrate the experience of prayer through drama, art,
music, technology, etc.

DF953BDE64A24198B94FF30ECD97996D.description:
Utilize prayer buddies within school, parish, or
community.

16AAC99D8D294439AD003FFCB810E586.description:
Discuss the formal prayers and know what the words
mean.

F383920B86554074B756905E1B5553C1.description:
Know and recite the following prayers: The Lord’s Prayer,
The Hail Mary, Glory Be, Act of Contrition, Nicene Creed,
Apostles Creed, Rosary.

177579A0C3554D5BBB25232D16235996.description: Participate in Mass, in prayers and in responses.

EFD18C55C8114944975CFCB5E0A74E46.description:
Experience the different forms of prayer through a variety
of prayer celebrations.

25A8B51FAAEE41E69B53B2B0F8B7B776.description: Experience the importance of prayer and appreciate a variety of prayer types and traditions-Skill

0CC19DFC434547298AFC11E1866D54D0.description:
Know that Faith Formation (Religion class) is not just
another academic subject, but is a lifelong journey.

42608490CAEB49369E2155CD1D000DE5.description:
Know that The Lord’s Prayer is the model prayer given to
us by Jesus.

FE74E75BE7B74380B09F0BE9D27DDF6B.description:
Know the importance of devotional prayer such as
Seasonal Customs (Advent Wreath, Way of the Cross),
Litanies, Rosary/Marian Devotions, etc.

E54EE28E99714CC69ADB0438655255AB.description:
Know the importance of liturgical prayer such as Mass and
Liturgy of the Hours (morning and evening prayers)

30EF6CDEAE4C4FBDB5E27F432AA2E253.description:
Know that the three expressions of prayer are vocal prayer,
meditation and contemplative prayer.

2473B3B152FA483CB466972471ABEDA2.description: Experience the importance of prayer and appreciate a variety of prayer types and traditions-Knowledge

A1909B604B41451EA16AC47869883F74.description: Recognize and engage in personal and communal Catholic forms of prayer, of scripture study, and of other experiences that deepen one’s spiritual life.

99572B9A3E264091A791E7B232C1B4F9.description:
Pray with family. (“Christian family is first place for
education and prayer”. CCC #2694)

FB5453B82B4344CAB2C26D1E5C0CDD22.description: Make prayer a part of their daily life.

136A342EBB894C94A37EB3474EB92EEC.description: Understand and accept the call to enter into a personal relationship with God-Life Application

A3C1703BD1FD42ABAD865C770B0CCFF3.description:
. Illustrate expressions of prayer through drama, art,
music, technology, etc.

C44599BD69DC44A4840E8ECE548A51E1.description:
Discuss prayer of blessing, of thanksgiving, of praise,
and of intercession.

9083486B7DDE4D299B86C8870A5FC550.description: Write a prayer letter to God.

E0358A4B94454BD8B9330B8B8CC74045.description:
Name things and tell how they might hurt a relationship
with God, such as hurtful conversations, etc

47A28538FB1A4BF4A0BBDC43FB79ED2D.description: Discuss ways to build a closer relationship with God.

50154275A47E4C419E09ACF091E4BC92.description:
Pray using various forms such as spontaneous, formal,
meditation, etc.

703B9C4D314A44849A41408715317342.description: Understand and accept the call to enter into a personal relationship with God-Skill

B9C46C94B4E54E02A67E2F3F99FF9740.description: Know there are many ways to pray.

1170F2CCDEDB4A768B45A77A0E7B9AE9.description:
Know basic forms of prayer are blessing, intercession,
thanksgiving and praise.

ABA6F56508A2431787C71CD971594AB7.description:
Know that prayer is the raising of their minds and hearts
to God.

1E480DB089EA4C4AA110FDAD27491B46.description: Know that prayer is a personal dialogue with God.

93CCD3DE330F41C6BAECAA25AEEEF18A.description: Know God calls each person to encounter God in prayer.

ABB19683B45D4EADBBA15BB77D90A4EE.description: Understand and accept the call to enter into a personal relationship with God-Knowledge

724EEDC98B9B4EE78CF0ED22B1CD55AB.description: Goal 4- Recognize and engage in personal and communal Catholic forms of prayer, of scripture study, and of other experiences that deepen one’s spiritual life.

3A70E23A0D8B4DCAB52F441506B48443.description: Demonstrate a Christian model of living.

8322026591394B3CB799A0F3719CB55B.description: Know that we are witnesses to the Gospel as responsible members of the local and of the universal Catholic Church, stewards of the world, and evangelizers for Christ-Life Application

C21F289A24B94E77A036ADF9E099616A.description:
Illustrate stewardship and evangelization through drama,
art, music, technology, etc.

969A2F49F4A4487F96DD4D280EEE36B4.description: Participate in experiences of environmental stewardship.

FBD656F8F2F045AA93FE4877C6785DEF.description:
Respect property and environment at school, at home, in the
parish and in the community.

9BCC50FF9DAF402CA4610E66516A25B2.description:
Describe how we can take care of God’s World, e.g. people,
animals, nature, etc.

40BDA43B46244E5598029181A779C2F9.description: Explain and discuss the responsibilities of being Catholic.

44ED32E710C942948BA6C6143FA290DB.description: Share faith with others through word and through deed.

89F032B928594595BB4419D0441E758F.description: Know that we are witnesses to the Gospel as responsible members of the local and of the universal Catholic Church, stewards of the world, and evangelizers for Christ-Skill

F9863AB19F514C4A9C6295C28C401DDD.description:
Know that our faith calls us to share the Good News of
Christ.

4FA9B62BCCF34FD4B1961FF1D3F8D8E8.description:
Learn about stewardship of God’s World, e.g. respect for
life, needs vs. wants, recycling, etc.

CBC840CE4FE5410FAC68C50AB236D7C2.description:
Know the responsibilities of being a member of the Catholic
Church.

2A6E846F756448929322B90E12CF47EC.description:
Know that we are members of the universal Catholic
Church.

E65BB92E4245471FBB927FFC36BE3BAD.description: Know that we are witnesses to the Gospel as responsible members of the local and of the universal Catholic Church, stewards of the world, and evangelizers for Christ-Knowledge

BC8B93065CA648F0ABD8A59D798F8058.description: Goal 3-Understand and appreciate that through Baptism we are called to life in Christ.

140A1154333642D7A939CA51028ED303.description: Be aware of God’s Grace in their lives and respond to it.

7F50AC255C004A0C97BB72DC10480FAC.description: Accept and recognize the presence of God’s grace in everyday life-Life Application

57D2670033BC461D8DFCF74F7C5267A7.description:
Illustrate God’s Friendship and Blessings using drama, art,
music, technology, etc.

F7C3D9BC87284E6A9E4AE96FDD47EC3A.description:
Recognize and share their personal experiences of God’s
grace.

C1078E7335A146968C80662513707126.description:
Discuss examples of how we are open to God’s Gift of
Grace.

9AF8D1DE7DEF49869A93E1A7225B4A1B.description: Accept and recognize the presence of God’s grace in everyday life-Skill

EAE0CC7CB6F542FEBE534E8D29879322.description: Know that God’s Presence helps us through difficult times.

988398132FBC4169A97098FFF3C1AA07.description:
Know that God has the power to make us better if we
cooperate with God.

F0A62EDCB993472FB2EA504462A390A7.description:
Know that God is reaching out to every person through the
Holy Spirit.

3276BDCD2D9D46F487F5D80B3B8F5300.description: Recognize God’s Presence and Grace in their daily lives.

A0A76293D95E4BC492A0E87C491860A0.description:
Know that “grace” is a gift freely given by God to help us
respond to the call to become God’s Children.

67D56DEA3C934CBB867D00DB73B661DE.description: Accept and recognize the presence of God’s grace in everyday life-Knowledge

3BF864827F8A405D9A6C542AEBE94BF2.description: Goal 3-Understand and appreciate that through Baptism we are called to life in Christ.

5271CD74FD13487987E8C3DE1B1CF64B.description:
Begin to perform acts of service for family, for Church and
for community.

F2932F4F87CA4E0DAA9538C99A25255F.description:
Reflect the love of Christ by loving, by caring and by
accepting others.

CE656536063A4F9C9374DFE0A00C9566.description: Know and understand the principles of Catholic Social Justice Teaching and experience how to apply them appropriately through a life of service-Life Application

0E9AC67DBD6C4255ADA9D109E8A3DD2E.description:
. Illustrate an understanding of helpfulness and a respect for
diversity using drama, art, music, technology, etc.

ECC1F6B18AB8480F932FF01BB90EA8CB.description: Plan a service project with class.

8B94C8BCC54B4119803F4F951935BFD1.description:
Discuss ways to help others through corporal and through
spiritual Works of Mercy.

5B195EE32BF8413CB17D19BE468EA46D.description: Discuss ways to consciously help others.

BCA823831CAC4671BFAB3757E2E5664A.description:
Identify people of service in the parish, in the community,
and in the world.

27DCEDC1E15A4613A23D571C97FCF31D.description: Know and understand the principles of Catholic Social Justice Teaching and experience how to apply them appropriately through a life of service-Skill

3C697982132F47CD8BF6B28ED558ABD1.description: Know the corporal and spiritual Works of Mercy.

F47CAC4514BD411DA6A0808848B277AE.description:
Know that they must respect themselves as the “dwelling
place” and “image” of God so that they can respect others.

D178223312E04882AD0DEDAFDF0C4D1F.description:
Know the meaning of Jesus’ law of love: Love one another
as I have loved you.

214F306951624FAAABD16343CF73DD5D.description:
Know that even though people are different, all are created
in God’s image.

6F06033D43CE4ACCA62A28D42D2AFCF2.description: Recognize that all people are God’s Children.

1D697068C9424964BE016E8C5A1A8678.description: Know and understand the principles of Catholic Social Justice Teaching and experience how to apply them appropriately through a life of service-Knowledge

6C9EABBBF8074D1AA8B91018AAD5FE3A.description: Goal 3-Understand and appreciate that through Baptism we are called to life in Christ.

CF3DE742C2C54BFDBFC7BFED22A70D86.description:
Incorporate the virtues (faith, hope, charity, prudence,
justice, fortitude and temperance) into their lives.

7C90245A3DF948B3ACB81EB9CAFFA34F.description: Develop a right relationship with God, others and self.

2C2C14E8BF93484BAC608AE472F22BE2.description: Understand the importance of the Beatitudes and of the Commandments as a means to the development of a well-formed conscience-Life Application

AD2FF147E01044D7981D4875BEE7D9A1.description:
Illustrate examples of living the Beatitudes, the Ten
Commandments, and the virtues using drama, art, music,
technology, etc.

A465D4CF4B4E45CC9DA0CD888B5453B4.description:
Examine their conscience using the Beatitudes and the Ten
Commandments.

3471667D6EDF4DCEB8479272F410FC8C.description: Tell the story of how we received the Ten Commandments.

B55C366D621346F3AAEE8EAE8DDCC863.description: Share the story of how we received the Beatitudes.

3626FCB8E6F2497287A488A0AFF5AC20.description: Understand the importance of the Beatitudes and of the Commandments as a means to the development of a well-formed conscience-Skill

73E0760C28D74BC2B2EA7C6EA4F25F86.description: Understand that sin is present in the world.

65B5CC016CB740E7B498A949F10A0F4E.description:
Recognize that to do right and to do wrong are conscious
decisions.

F95F5A61C99E48F19E6A8A3184A9A4CB.description:
Understand that they have free will and that they are to
make informed choices.

233E7C79949547FB8768BFBB5378AD20.description:
Be familiar with the theological virtues (faith, hope,
charity) and with the cardinal virtues (prudence, justice,
fortitude, temperance).

EEE0ACCAC62E422AB461BC3B75A21C60.description: Understand that virtues are daily habits of doing good.

3321574820264F819D7B9085412B42D3.description: Know the Ten Commandments come from God.

5C568DD2F40549618FC9611EAEBCA3F3.description:
Know the Beatitudes as Jesus’ teaching about how to live
and to find happiness.

C943EA85CA964631BD09A9EC5D0B9EDE.description: Understand the importance of the Beatitudes and of the Commandments as a means to the development of a well-formed conscience-Knowledge

CBFAA76FEC154A4AB83521A64459FA14.description: Goal 3-Understand and appreciate that through Baptism we are called to life in Christ.

4F069D3EDD05469BB711B2E06D386A93.description:
Express appreciation for Jesus’ gift to us by being kind,
by being generous, and of service to others.

1A88AB1BD90D4C59BFF3F4705D2C1B84.description:
Participate in the Eucharist (Sunday Mass) with family
and with community.

AA0C0DDBA9DE4890A70104CD84FB966A.description: Appreciate the Eucharist and understand that it is central to our lives and the life of the Catholic Church-Life Application

FF0F03AB2FE54D0480183F24DF2E46AD.description:
Illustrate an understanding of the Eucharist using
drama, art, music, technology, etc.

42066ED072BB4869AE05BA0C84A56294.description:
Reflect and express their appreciation of the
Eucharist.

A62C0EBE0C5E4C2A94D6B9972C6EEEBC.description:
Explain how their active participation in the liturgy
helps build the Body of Christ.

7B0325F3D4B8401B97DCCB885D1FF129.description: Accept and recognize the presence of God’s grace in everyday life-Skill

166E4416A30C4950A758A59B66C9F947.description:
Know the proper etiquette and appropriate
disposition for receiving Eucharist.

CB6F47818F1646EF9251AABF0478D57F.description:
Know that the effect of the Eucharist is to build up
the Body of Christ, the Church.

0F3177B6C3254E5184204268ECDB200E.description:
Know and believe that through the power of the
Holy Spirit, the bread and wine are transformed
into the Body and Blood of Jesus, and that Jesus is
truly present.

39ED0CC3B12E43198EEBAB7C4477FFED.description:
Know that Eucharist is the memorial and making
present of Christ’s Passover, the work of salvation
accomplished by the life, death and resurrection of
Christ.

5B36A954B46148E4A60B225BB8838A2C.description:
Appreciate the Eucharist (Mass) as the most
important celebration of our Catholic Faith
Community.

06991CDEA4DE48B293EC10448D54B90E.description: Appreciate the Eucharist and understand that it is central to our lives and the life of the Catholic Church-Knowledge

FFF4B1A67CC74C6C941AA2C8B83DCD4F.description: Goal 2-Know and appreciate the importance of the liturgy and of the sacraments in the life of Catholics.

B1A598067FC440E2A66C1655E9C5DE5F.description:
Share stories about family member’s experiences of the
sacraments.

B55EE73FC93E463CA715C33C4307FA0E.description: Participate in the celebration of the sacraments.

E6ABC736A3FC4810AB2C56E3BC8A8DC8.description: Comprehend that sacraments are an outward sign of God’s Love having the power to transform our lives-Life Application

737F168A6D8F4A24B4A5880C83D334E1.description:
Illustrate an understanding of how God’s love is
shown through the seven sacraments using drama, art,
music, technology, etc.

E085A4B2C57D4990A91C7E4E4960A6A8.description:
Explain why the celebration of the sacraments is a
sign of God’s loving presence and saving power.

4A1DF92B0CB24D3397A21C97B3F25EAF.description:
Reflect on and express their experiences of sacrament
celebrations.

12D24CC49CF9427490B7C15ACCB1D58F.description: Comprehend that sacraments are an outward sign of God’s Love having the power to transform our lives-Skill

AA56EE4567C04B5299615B1947EC42EC.description:
Know the proper disposition for receiving the
sacraments (CCC1128).

9EF1DA6AD16840DFB169B18039636A0C.description:
Understand that the sacraments are a community
celebration.

6AF5AB45B7814091B7B2B36F695C3444.description:
Know how God’s love and saving power is celebrated
and is received in each of the seven sacraments.

E8FF115517AA4A6385CD83EEEEF6C7A4.description: Know symbols and signs for each sacrament.

DB184799AA744A3BB31772F841F06EB2.description:
Know the seven sacraments as sacraments of
initiation, vocation and healing.

1FF323B04ED7440A8854A96F31FE3561.description: Comprehend that sacraments are an outward sign of God’s Love having the power to transform our lives-Knowledge

B612C7F6D10245ED8B742CB224E17A7F.description: Goal 2- Know and appreciate the importance of the liturgy and of the sacraments in the life of Catholics.

A98EF99BB1774B9B9A1C8B27F298E36B.description:
Demonstrate etiquette and reverence while actively
participating in liturgical celebration.

56A7F443FA93466295B233B67CAC9768.description:
Participate with family in weekend liturgy throughout the
year.

F768C318E8354F73931389CD47217715.description: Recognize and participate in the Catholic Church’s liturgical life as a means to encounter Christ in its feasts, seasons, symbols, practices, and prayers-Life Application

3C304C7D20A74AC28E5855235FBAD269.description:
Integrate Church’s seasonal celebrations into their lives and
into their family traditions.

79E3DBEE1B314534ADC98CD9E672F9C9.description:
Reflect on their experiences of liturgical celebrations using
the senses, i.e. what you hear, what you see, what you
smell, etc. (Mystagogia).

CD634B6356994CAAAEFB4E9C649BB350.description:
Design, prepare, set-up a classroom prayer center to reflect
liturgical season.

388F5EF517D84E55954D7516D5F98DA4.description:
Participate in various liturgical roles, including the
Assembly.

A991AA23CED2430BAE5E06D18332F9F0.description:
Use prayer, reflection, ritual, and community worship to
celebrate an awareness of God’s presence in their life.

0A82699E5BED4F1E84350686C1B7A601.description: Recognize and participate in the Catholic Church’s liturgical life as a means to encounter Christ in its feasts, seasons, symbols, practices, and prayers-Skill

0FF8AC85E3B947569404333F370BCDE3.description:
Know the different parts of the Mass: Liturgy of Word and
Liturgy of Eucharist.

5D251F32FBB044B1B04914C3A54F91FC.description:
Know the symbols, practices, and celebrations (including
cultural celebrations) of the liturgical year.

0EB232F5E1D242B9B034D1BEBB621D56.description:
Know that Sunday is the principal day for celebration of
Eucharist.

B5D6DBA3F7984261933C16A35B17F89C.description: Recognize and participate in the Catholic Church’s liturgical life as a means to encounter Christ in its feasts, seasons, symbols, practices, and prayers-Knowledge

E3785910413E4253B6E7F5CCD4A83BB4.description: Goal 2- Know and appreciate the importance of the liturgy and of the sacraments in the life of Catholics.

9D7B44C3D36E4094B540B923DEA5E26A.description:
Spread the Gospel message by joyfully sharing our faith
and our practices with others.

F209A7EB00BD49A3AC37726DF92735D6.description: Understand the origin and Tradition of the Catholic Church and its mission to spread the Gospel message-Life Application

416AA7F8C4A6411CBE10124D698B894C.description:
Illustrate the origin, Tradition and mission of the Church
using drama, art, music, technology, etc.

596A449F9C1647D4BEE0409434EA89F0.description:
Compare/contrast general family traditions with Tradition
of the Church.

841001A2DE7B4383A68921E0277E0FE6.description:
Connect values of early Christian community with
contemporary issues.

14D968F1EFC2494BB68D04920EB3555E.description:
Appreciate and share Catholic Tradition, beliefs and
heritage.

10633F35DF614A8F9AE461DB69B67A27.description: Understand the origin and Tradition of the Catholic Church and its mission to spread the Gospel message-Skill

E782F94BAC8B4354B04F79F7EBD6AC0D.description:
Be familiar with current structure of the Church and with
the roles within the community.

849AAEAB63D148129743C8517447F598.description:
Know that our Tradition includes various forms of prayer
and of devotion.

8696C4CFFE8B49D1B42134478A7D01A3.description: Understand the role of Tradition in the Church.

A2EA68F548554364A9C3ACC55E1004CC.description: Know the significance of Pentecost to the Church.

7BD6D745395643E3ABFDA66C70C0DFEC.description:
Know that Tradition comes from the apostles who handed
on what they received from Jesus and what they learned
from the Holy Spirit (CCC 83).

237AF7341ABD4E6A9927F24A1D5724DD.description: Understand the origin and Tradition of the Catholic Church and its mission to spread the Gospel message-Knowledge

C507EE8B346945F4A6639BDA74726B15.description: Goal 1-Know and understand the basic teachings of the Catholic Church.

16F6A5060FEB49BEA4EFF38124FDF72B.description:
Celebrate with family the special days honoring Mary and
the saints.

39FC628AB08D4FC3A4867F2A2447D875.description:
Continue to develop devotion to Mary and to the saints in
their personal prayer life.

CDB17B7EF48C4DF1A34343102798BA24.description:
Accept the example of Mary and of the saints as models for
daily living.

8C962B64FCFA42ACA7F09489E55C3110.description: Know and apply the teachings of the Catholic Church as they are reflected in the life of the Virgin Mary, in the Communion of Saints and in the Church-Life Application

610C14CCC0D6493CB197402F94CA6BD2.description:
Illustrate the lives of Mary and the saints as models of
discipleship using drama, art, music, technology, etc.

CDD91295E1DD405DB3FCD79CFC4353C6.description: Report on a patron saint or another saint.

CCD291CABA0E46F9838943860A2A7773.description: Pray the Rosary and other Marian devotions.

D393271F978C4C7D9F7A6DE9E5757CD6.description: Know and apply the teachings of the Catholic Church as they are reflected in the life of the Virgin Mary, in the Communion of Saints and in the Church-Skill

7F771505FD684835927BE4266C844A61.description:
Recognize faith in action in the lives of Mary, in the saints,
and in members of the Church.

04D839F36CD146BE8F9C36450452EF79.description:
Be familiar with the communion of saints and be able to
recognize saints as models of discipleship.

8068D7B67A6A45708AFCD578FB203291.description:
Recognize how different cultures, both past and present,
honor Mary.

58C8CEC01A9F414C880AC655BDC1C269.description: Recognize Mary as model of Christian discipleship.

F6F7E43D81C5418F8806A8FA962EC0BD.description: Know and apply the teachings of the Catholic Church as they are reflected in the life of the Virgin Mary, in the Communion of Saints and in the Church-Knowledge

E9648F250B2840F18DCE6F563C2E79B9.description: Act in ways that show they follow Jesus.

7B2E8C87C8E746719E1BC8B216327C40.description: Be attentive to Liturgy of the Word at Sunday Mass.

6D1BAAE17F4C4DEC9632CFCE77E017FC.description: Standard B: Understand the life of Jesus as revealed through Sacred Scripture-Life Application

A86637A9A5EB441F96B0CFF28494AA97.description:
Illustrate Bible Stories through drama, art, music,
technology, etc.

1E51FF3EC80D479FA88310D373606508.description: Give examples of how they can imitate Christ.

049A71A5FCDD4B2984CE15394154D85A.description:
Identify the value expressed in the Gospel Stories and tell
how they would apply this value to their life.

28454C14AD75486B9164FB3C8A73B68D.description: Connect Bible Stories to their personal experiences.

249CF251CF754989A8243C1BA2E3833A.description: Tell the story of Jesus’ Life.

23D8907C85EA4319A0281C0A590CA5C2.description: Standard B: Understand the life of Jesus as revealed through Sacred Scripture-Skill

B3300C9E4D774F0F907BEBEAB86BA4F9.description:
Know life of Jesus through Church year, traditions,
devotions (Rosary, Stations of the Cross, etc.), and prayers.

032A0A3542CF4F798ACE07657F73BCBC.description:
Be familiar with the life and the teachings of Jesus as told in
Scripture.

6D0764CB59F44287B71BCC91114A5BC2.description:
Recognize Jesus in the Gospel and how Jesus’ life applies to
their lives.

608502D9959F4ED68FCA7AC0CF9CEEF7.description: Standard B: Understand the life of Jesus as revealed through Sacred Scripture-Knowledge

66C13B54FE6542FBBA5198D5879052B2.description: Goal 1-Know and understand the basic teachings of the Catholic Church

9EF6DA41331948EA8E2845D664A19825.description:
Share with family their understanding of God: Father, Son
and Holy Spirit.

960496866DAB4AE59AF04D0EC3E7D99D.description:
Attend Mass with family and pray the Nicene Creed along
with assembly.

009542E0EA194B1194B51466C1936AB6.description: Standard A: Recognize that the Creed reveals the fundamental teachings of the Catholic Church-Life Application

F01D4241D90C485E8284FEC5308ED1BD.description: Illustrate beliefs using drama, art, music, technology, etc.

D40FD486022C41489A2FFF0659E40BF7.description: Recite the Nicene Creed with others.

7B1761B4C3774B6797CD83938A6141BB.description: Recite the Apostles’ Creed from memory.

D9412995095C4E4CB8C8205916AF2905.description: Standard A: Recognize that the Creed reveals the fundamental teachings of the Catholic Church-Skill

A3681E5B51324FBE81723BD7A952915E.description:
Recognize the Nicene Creed as an important part of the
Mass and of our Christian life.

CD03F51DE6FB4B3E927C2909D047EAE2.description:
Identify our Catholic beliefs as stated in the Creed – from
Creation to Life Everlasting.

A46C1EA772D945C7ADCC7F86150B4D54.description: Break down the Creed to understand each part.

02D571E01DF345399FB8A064C67A6A28.description:
Know the terms and understand the outline of the Creed
(CCC 184 ff): one God: Father, Son, Holy Spirit; Church.

AAFDE96672A748389FF1E6D11FAEFFA5.description:
Recognize that both the Apostles’ Creed and the Nicene
Creed are statements of our faith.

A2B866E0FA9449CE8F6CB2C2B85054B9.description:
Recognize the Creed as a statement of our beliefs as
Catholics.

1C8E1B657CD641FDB7F94FA25F4D0717.description:
Know that God’s very being is truth and is love: all present,
all knowing and eternal.
